intro: Brunellia darienensis, commonly known as the Darien bignay, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are typically red or yellow when ripe, containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
